items.title: No file created with --json flag on amazonlinux
items.body:
Hi I am running pytest-json on an amazonlinux docker container with python2.7 using the following command.

`python -m pytest ${test_modules} --json=test_report.json`

All my unit tests run fine, but the final json file is not created.
I am running this with a root user and If I run the same lines of code in report.py to create the file I see no issue.

Here is the console output:

```
(venv) bash-4.2# python -m pytest ${test_modules} --json=test_report.json
====================================================================================== test session starts =======================================================================================
platform linux2 -- Python 2.7.13, pytest-3.0.6, py-1.5.2, pluggy-0.4.0
rootdir: /usr/local/project-name, inifile:
plugins: json-0.4.0
collected 8 items

test_transaction.py ........

---------------------------------------------------- generated json report: /usr/local/project-name/test_report.json -----------------------------------------------------
==================================================================================== 8 passed in 2.41 seconds ====================================================================================
(venv) bash-4.2# pwd
/usr/local/project-name
(venv) bash-4.2# ls test_report.json
ls: cannot access test_report.json: No such file or directory
(venv) bash-4.2#
```
